channel.title: I log out and my server stops laggin.. Log in and it laggs everyone
channel.description:
Basically.. Im hosting a server for me and my friends...
Now they say that when im logged out that it isnt laggy..
But when i log in.. Its laggy for me and my friends on the server..
And help or ideas will be greatly appreciated! :D

item.title: I log out and my server stops laggin.. Log in and it laggs everyone
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Nooooo your all silly.

The server (If coded well) uses very little resources which is why there is no lag when you do not have the client running

The client on the other hand uses about a lot more computer resources (The amount depends on whether the client has a Jframe, Whether some dumbshit has fiddled with it etc) and therefore is what is causing the lag. As far as I know there is no solution and the players should just deal with it.

Some things that may reduce the lag are:
If you have a gameframe on ur client (Gui) Find a client that doesnt have one (Even if its only for you) Gui’s are a major resource chewer.
If you have a dodge client I recommend getting one from a well known source. E.g Stewie_'s Client, Bluurs client modified by Shic or any of Galkons Clients just to name a few.
I do not recommend Feburgen’s client for you the hoster as this has a huge Gameframe and will cause a lot of lag.

Read full topic
item.source: I log out and my server stops laggin.. Log in and it laggs everyone

item.title: I log out and my server stops laggin.. Log in and it laggs everyone
item.dc:creator: @birdman4657 birdman4657
item.description:
@birdman4657 wrote:

1 gig is plenty of ram to run a server and play on it at the same time…

goto http://www.speedtest.net/ and test your internet connection

Read full topic

item.title: I log out and my server stops laggin.. Log in and it laggs everyone
item.dc:creator: @birdman4657 birdman4657
item.description:
@birdman4657 wrote:

well first of all…

it may be because you have a slow internet connection…
it may be because you are running a computer with a small amount of RAM (usually why)

there are several possible reasons why this could happen
